public interface zeta.session.Session

(source file: Session.pizza)
java.lang.Object
   |
   +----zeta.session.Session
The pure class interface. 
public interface Session
The type of sessions.

A session is opened by methods provided by the class SessionManager. A session works on persistent data stored in a `project' which is named when opening a session with the session manager. All access to the persistent project data is done via a session object, or objects derived from a session object, such as units.

For the realization of tool adaptors, a session provides a model to manage tool-internal persistent data.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: Session.pizza,v 1.14 2000/05/16 08:10:47 wg Exp $
See also:
SessionManager, Unit, Adaptor

initialize
public abstract void initialize();
Initialize the session, loading adaptors and units belonging to the session. Before initialization, a message listener should have been installed to monitor messages of tool adaptor startup.

See also:
registerListener

lookupUnit

public abstract Unit lookupUnit(Name name)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.UnresolvableName, zeta.session.Failures.AmbigiousName;
Lookup a unit by a (partial) unit name. The partial name has the syntax 
  [TOOL:]toolspecificname
Hence it is possible to omit the name of tool. For the toolspecificname, further components may be missing -- which these are is defined by the individual tools.

If the TOOL qualifier is missing, then the session system queries all registered tool adaptors whether they can lookup a unit of this partial name. If it is given, then the session system queries exactly the designated adaptor. In any case, the given name is passed as is to the tool adaptors.

Throws:
Failures.UnresolvableName - the TOOL -- if given -- does not exists, or no queried tool adaptor can lookup the name.
Failures.AmbigiousName - querying one or more tool adaptors lead to an ambiguous resolution of this name
See also:
lookupUnit

getUnit

public abstract Unit getUnit(Name unitName)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.NoSuchEntity;
Get a unit by its unit name. If the unit exists, it will be returned, otherwise an exception will be thrown.

getOrCreateUnit

public abstract Unit getOrCreateUnit(Name unitName);
Get or create a unit by its unit name. If the unit exists, it will be returned. Otherwise a new empty unit of the given name is returned. This method is mainly used by source adaptors to create a unit.

getUnits

public abstract Unit[] getUnits();
Get all units in the sessions project.

unitLocator

public abstract Locator unitLocator(Unit unit);
Get a locator which can be used to visit this unit. @seee Adaptor.unitLocator

lookupAdaptor

public abstract Adaptor lookupAdaptor(Name name)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.NoSuchEntity;
Lookup a tool adaptor by its name.

registerAdaptor

public abstract void registerAdaptor(Class adaptorClass)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.EntityExists;
Register a tool adaptor. An instance of the given class will be created, and registered under the name it defines by its method getName. It is an error to register an adaptor which uses a name already in use.

Adaptor registration keeps persistent during sessions. It is not possible to remove a once registered adaptor.

getAdaptors

public abstract Adaptor[] getAdaptors();
Return the tool adaptors present in this session.

getToolDir

public abstract File getToolDir(Name name);
Get an (existing) directory where the named tool adaptor may store its auxiliary files. The name-space of this directory has to be managed by the tool adaptor.

getLibDir

public abstract File getLibDir();
Get library directory. Get the directory were Zeta auxiliary executables, scripts, shared libraries, etc. reside. Usually, the return directory is 
$ZETABASE/lib
.

getClassDir

public abstract File getClassDir();
Get class directory. Get directory of Zeta classes. Usually this directory is 
$ZETABASE/classes

checkExternalData

public abstract void checkExternalData();
Let all tool adaptors update their assumptions about external data.

See also:
checkExternalData

allocate

public abstract StorageHandle allocate();
Allocate persistent storage.

free

public abstract void free(StorageHandle handle);
Free persistent storage.

store

public abstract void store(StorageHandle handle,
                           Serializable object);
Store serializable object into persistent storage.

load

public abstract Serializable load(StorageHandle handle);
Load serializable object from persistent storage. Returns null if an object was never stored under handle.

send

public abstract void send(Name sender,
                          Message message);
Dispatch the given message to all registered listeners. The given name should be the name of the tool adaptor where this message originates from.

registerListener

public abstract void registerListener(Class[] classes,
                                      Listener listener);
Register the given listener object to receive messages which are instances of given classes. If classes is null, all messages will be received.

Note that listener registration is not persistent; tool adaptors have to (re-)register their listeners at initialization time.

unregisterListener

public abstract void unregisterListener(Listener listener);
Unregister the given listener (identified by reference).

registerForm

public abstract void registerForm(TopLevelForm form);
Register the given top-level form.

Note that form registration is not persistent; tool adaptors have to (re-)register their forms at initialization time.

unregisterForm

public abstract void unregisterForm(TopLevelForm form);
Unregister the given form (by object identity).

execForm

public abstract void execForm(String prompt,
                              TopLevelForm form)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.FormFailed;
Modal execute the given form by the shell of this session. Throws a failure if no shell is registered.

getForms

public abstract TopLevelForm[] getForms();
Return the top-level forms of the session.

registerShell

public abstract void registerShell(Shell shell);
Set the given shell to be responsible for form execution in this session. Shell registration is not persistent, and should be done by the startup code of a session.

registerTextEditor

public abstract void registerTextEditor(TextEditor editor);
Set the given text editor to be responsible for visiting locators and editing files.

getTextEditor

public abstract TextEditor getTextEditor();
Get the current text editor, or null if none has registered.

registerContentType

public abstract void registerContentType(ContentType type);
Register the given content type for this session.

Note that content type registration is not persistent; tool adaptors have to (re-)register the content types they serve at initialization time.

lookupContentType

public abstract ContentType lookupContentType(Name name)
  throws zeta.session.Failures.NoSuchEntity;
Lookup a content type by name.

getContentTypes

public abstract ContentType[] getContentTypes();
Return the content types registered for this session.

exit

public abstract void exit();
Exit a session and the running JVM. Makes actions to perform necessary saves of the sessions data.

abort

public abstract void abort();
Abort a session and the running JVM. Changes on the sessions data are not saved.

abort

public abstract void abort(Throwable e);
Report about a runtime exeception, and let the session die, exiting the running JVM. Changes on the sessions data are not saved.
